comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Possibly James Norton, a golf pro from Trenton, NJ. From page 28 of The American Golfer, v 9, November 1912 [see www.la84foundation.org/SportsLibrary/AmericanGolfer/1912/...]: "In a four-ball match at the Trenton Country Club J. J. McDermott, the Open champion, and James Norton, the local pro., beat Aleck Smith (Wykagyl) and Willie Norton (Deal) by 2 holes." New York Times. August 23, 1910, Tuesday query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F04EED71230E233A... gives the Trenton golfer 'H" as middle initial.
